titleStmt.title: Andrewes humble petition vnto almighty God, declaring his repentance Newly made in a right zealous and most godly prayer, out of the pure fountaine of holy scripture, in the autumne or declining of his age. Very necessary for all the children of God to vse in their daily praiers. Wherein is contained an alarum for old age: a watch-word for youth, and a caueat for all Christians.
titleStmt.author: Andrewes, John, fl. 1615.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by G. Eld] for Iohn Wright, and are to be sold at his shop without Newgate, at the signe of the Bible,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: An humble petition to almighty God.
On title page verso are the same verses as in STC 594 (Christ his crosse), indicating Andrewes sold copies of this.--STC.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
